ODE XXIV. To VIRGIL.

And hath the sleep that knows no waking morn Closed o'er Quinctilius, our Quinctilius dear?

Where shall be found the man of woman born That in desert might be esteemed his peer,—

Sincere as he, and resolutely just, ¹

So high of heart, and all so absolute of trust?
